--- In unschoolingbasics@ yahoogroups. com, Tamara Griesel <griesellists@ ...> wrote:
>
> They're looking to do retreats of various kinds...I'm actually trying to figure out how to put together a regional unschooling conference out there in a couple of years, but I need to research local activities that might interest families.  It really is pretty rural (population around 3000, about an hour north of Dubuque.)
************ ********* ********* ********* **

If you're really thinking about a regional conference, you might want to contact Alex in MN: polykowholsteins@ yahoo.com

Give her a couple days, though, she just stepped on her laptop!

---Meredith

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Wisconsin uschooling
messages.msgSnippet: They re looking to do retreats of various kinds...I m actually trying to figure out how to put together a regional unschooling conference out there in a couple
messages.messageBody:
They're looking to do retreats of various kinds...I'm actually trying to figure out how to put together a regional unschooling conference out there in a couple of years, but I need to research local activities that might interest families.  It really is pretty rural (population around 3000, about an hour north of Dubuque.)
 
Tamara
 
 


--- On Thu, 3/26/09, Tammy Curry <mamabeart00@...> wrote:

From: Tammy Curry <mamabeart00@...>
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Wisconsin uschooling
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, March 26, 2009, 1:56 PM






Oh what an adventure to go on! That sounds like it will be such a blast. Ok, so I love old houses and the idea of having a bed and breakfast in one is awesome. It is something that we have discussed doing as well, actually recreating a "period" farm type of thing. Buying an old homestead and turning it into a working piece of history. I would love to know how it all goes for you. :)

Tammy Curry, Director of Chaos
http://tammycurry. blogspot. com/
http://crazy- homeschool- adventures. blogspot. com/
http://myspace. com/mamabeart00


____________ _________ _________ __
From: griesellists <griesellists@ yahoo.com>
To: unschoolingbasics@ yahoogroups. com
Sent: Thursday, March 26, 2009 11:13:03 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Wisconsin uschooling

We may be moving to rural Southwestern Wisconsin in six months to a year. My inlaws have purchased an 1880's era hotel/bed and breakfast with a restaurant and will move out in June to start the restoration process. We hope to follow when we figure out what to do for income there. (I had planned to apply for graduate programs in Madison, but I'm not sure I can do that while unschooling. )

The nearest larger population centers are Dubuque, IA, and Madison, WI. I was wondering if anyone knew about unschooling/ homeschooling communities in the area.

Tammy Curry, Director of Chaos

We hope to follow when we figure out what to do for income there. (I had planned to apply for graduate programs in Madison, but I'm not sure I can do that while unschooling.)
